text:
Do Wander in 
Into the land
of sand 
and of skeletons
wander in
to where the boat
has stranded
so very long ago
long ago
this place used to be full of life
but now it's dead
only skeletons remain
it has been eons 
since it last rained
underground
is still some life
the last remains from 
so long ago
do explore
but watch out
for yourselves
the burning sun
and your own shadow

author: NinjaMinkzx

text: @jacobpotter Because I think that when they make a game that is being released within a year after a new handheld, the developpers try not to use up too much memory space until they know for sure how much they can put in, that's what I meant. Still, I think that all three Mario & Luigi games are longer than handheld games that aren't RPGs.
author: 64SuperNintendo

text:
@64SuperNintendo 
That doesn't explain anything. DS cards have way more space, regardless of when they came out.
author: McBehrer

text: @jacobpotter And PiT was released within a year after the DS, unlike SS which was released two years after the GBA, meaning that they had enough memory space in the game. PiT most likely didn't have enough memory space, since it was releasd within a year after the DS, which might explain why it was kind of short.
author: 64SuperNintendo

text: @jacobpotter I usually don't consider the sidequests as being part of a game (they are optional), I usually count a game to be as long as it takes to finish the main plot and defeating every enemy in the way (to be leveled up as much as possible), on a second run. Which is why I said that they both take equally as long. Of course, everybody plays a game at their own pace.
author: 64SuperNintendo
McBehrer

text: @jacobpotter How much longer? Because this takes around 15 hours when you're familiar with the game, and Partners in Time takes about 15 hours also when you're familiar with the game. That's just MY completion times, though.
author: 64SuperNintendo

text:
@64SuperNintendo 
no way. SS is way, WAY longer.

author: chief

text:
@OverObsessiveNekoBoy 
I'd have it in a different order, but close. SS is easily the best, because it's really long and just overall badass. Partners in Time was the dark horse, since it's so short. still a damn good game though. BIS is my second favorite; it's actually still pretty long, and really well made. plus that final boss music! *eargasm*
author: McBehrer

text:
Superstar Saga: Amazing classic. If you don't have it, you're an idiot.
Partners in Time: Definetly the least good of the three, but still a very good game.
Bowser's Inside Story: My favorite of the three because of how fluid the game feels, and because the music is just amazing. My only complaint is that it's too short =/
